subject: Music
title: Music and Sleep
description: A fast breakdown of Music and Sleep for builders.

hook.text: People who listen to calm music before bed fall asleep faster and sleep deeper.

buildup.text: Slow music around 60 BPM relaxes muscles and slows breathing toward sleep patterns.

discovery.text: Over several weeks, a bedtime music habit improves sleep quality as much as medication.

twist.text: The music must be familiar â€” novel songs engage attention instead of relaxation.

climax.text: Lullabies work because parents discovered this principle thousands of years ago.

punchline.text: The oldest sleep hack in history still works.

quiz.question: Why must bedtime music be familiar?
options: Novel songs engage attention instead of promoting relaxation
